attributes.comment:
I am an american citizen. My husband will be an immigrant to this country. I
most definitely think that the fees are extremely high. I am a professional,
educated woman, and I work an incredible number of hours. As I am self-
employed, my taxes are most definitely painful enough. I cannot save money
because I need it to spend on things that are deductible, and when I don't spend
it, I have to give it to the government. The current fees are already almost too
much to bear on top of rent, gas, utilities and all of the other ridiculously high living
expenses. 190 dollars for the I-130, 170 dollars for the I-129F, hundreds of dollars
for the I-485, more fees so that he will be able to work here..... FORTY PERCENT
of my income to taxes....... By increasing the fees as much as is proposed, it is
absolutely insane to expect me and my husband to be able to pay the new
amounts in addition to daily living expenses! My husband will not be able to help
financially at the start, as he comes from a country where living day to day is
significantly less, which in turn makes his income significantly insignificant as
compared to the painful cost of living in the United States. I make about 30,000
dollars a year, and I can guarantee that this is far more than the average
immigrant salary. This country was BUILT on immigrants, (my great-great
grandfather came here with 7 dollars in his pocket) and by making it so
impossible for people to come and have the right to build a better life (legally), is
absolutely arrogrant. And by the way, why are people complaining about the cost
of *illegal* immigrants on this forum? As much as I agree that I do not want my
taxes paying for those who are here illegally, the immigration services are for
those who are trying to go through the system in the proper way. Furthermore,
the number of illegal immigrants will likely skyrocket through the roof, because
they will want to live here, but will never have even a CHANCE to afford the costs
involved to even try. I would like to see someone with a family who can live on
minimum wage or less (most of the illegals), and still try to go through the pipeline
legally. Has the USCIS even considered this most likely probability?????? Do
you think you see too many illegals now? Just triple and quadruple the fees, and
watch the immigration lawyer fees go up, and you will see illegals in abundance.
No one can live on minimum wage. We are seeing to it that it should be
impossible to live any sort of dream by taxing the citizens into debt while they
labor and watch their families crumble just to make ends meet.
Please... stay self-sufficient, but let people have a chance with some dignity. We
are killing ourselves out here.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
